sub_topic: Using the mean value theorem to solve problems
message_1: A company produces 5000 units of a product in 10 days. Determine the average rate at which the production must increase to meet their target of producing a total of 8000 units within 18 days, using the mean value theorem.
message_2:
Let's denote the total production function as P(t), where t is the number of days. We are given that P(10) = 5000 units and the target is P(18) = 8000 units.

According to the Mean Value Theorem, there exists a point c in the interval (10, 18) such that the average rate of change of the production function P(t) in this interval is equal to the instantaneous rate of change at that point c:

(P(18) - P(10)) / (18 - 10) = P'(c)

We are asked to find the average rate at which the production must increase, which is the same as the average rate of change of the production function P(t) in the interval (10, 18). So, we need to find:

(P(18) - P(10)) / (18 - 10)

Substitute the given values:

(8000 - 5000) / (18 - 10) = 3000 / 8 = 375 units/day

Therefore, the average rate at which the production must increase to meet their target is 375 units per day.
